titlestmt.titleproper: League of Women Voters of Philadelphia records 1920-1961
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: League of Women Voters of Philadelphia records
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: In addition to educating the public during election campaigns, the League took stands on local issues concerning child care, city management, housing, public education, public health; national issues of the legal status of women and taxation of oleo margarine; and foreign policy questions including the United Nations and the Marshall Plan. The Philadelphia chapter communicated with the national and state League organizations, politicians, civic leaders, and organizations.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, board minutes, budget and other committee reports, memoranda, circulars of League of Women Voters of Philadelphia. Most of the material is for the years 1941-1959, but the files are neither complete nor consistent.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the League of Women Voters of Philadelphia, per Mrs. Herbert Catheart.
